items.title: When we released Claude Opus 4.5, we knew future models would be close to our AI Safety Level 4 thre
items.summary:
When we released Claude Opus 4.5, we knew future models would be close to our AI Safety Level 4 threshold for autonomous AI R&D. We therefore committed to writing sabotage risk reports for future frontier models.

Today we‚Äôre delivering on that commitment for Claude Opus 4.6.

items.title: How could AI act as a better research collaborator? üßë‚Äçüî¨
items.summary:
How could AI act as a better research collaborator? üßë‚Äçüî¨

In two new papers with @GoogleResearch, we show how Gemini Deep Think uses agentic workflows to help solve research-level problems in mathematics, physics, and computer science.

More ‚Üí https://t.co/yMseF1xhnR

developer_platform.summary:

Every engineer uses their tools differently. We built Claude Code from the ground up

developer_platform.title: 28 Days of Claude API - Day 11 - Vision
developer_platform.summary:
28 Days of Claude API - Day 11 - Vision

Claude can see images. You probably knew that. But did you know:

‚Üí Up to 100 images per request
‚Üí Pass a URL directly
‚Üí Token cost: (width √ó height)/750
‚Üí Files API support (upload once, reference by file_id)

JPEG, PNG, GIF, WebP.

developer_platform.title: Dulu: "Engineer = kerja berat"
developer_platform.summary:
Dulu: "Engineer = kerja berat"
Sekarang: "Engineer = kerja ringan"
Dengan adanya AI:
1. Claude Code ‚Üí Agentic coding
2. Copilot ‚Üí Autocomplete
3. Codex ‚Üí Async/cloud coding agent
4. Lovable ‚Üí Frontend builder
5. Kimi ‚Üí Deep research + coding agent tools
6. Gemini ‚Üí Deep think + multimodal
7. OpenClaw ‚Üí Personal AI 24/7

Mereka yg kerja, gue yg dapet duit
If you're in a quarter-life crisis, pls consider become engineer in 2026.

developer_platform.title: AWS released a new Multi-Agent AI framework!
developer_platform.summary:
AWS released a new Multi-Agent AI framework!

A flexible and powerful framework for managing multiple AI agents and handling complex conversations.

It let's you dynamically route LLM queries to the most suitable agent based on context.

100% Open Source. https://t.co/22kNYSJwul

100% Open Source https://t.co/9AgBJVqLZ0

developer_platform.title: Everyone is building AI agents.
developer_platform.summary:
Everyone is building AI agents.
Very few understand the agentic frameworks that actually power them.

In 2025, two frameworks dominate agent development ‚Äî
not as competitors, but as complementary layers:

n8n ‚Äî Visual Workflow Automation

What it does
‚Ä¢ Visually connects AI agents with business tools and APIs
‚Ä¢ Flow: Trigger ‚Üí AI Agent ‚Üí Tools ‚Üí Action
‚Ä¢ Removes integration complexity and speeds up deployment

Think of it as:
The orchestrator that plugs AI into your entire tech stack

‚Äî

LangGra

product_ecosystem.title: We're bringing some of Claude‚Äôs most-used features to the free plan.

We're bringing some of Claude‚Äôs most-used features to the free plan.

File creation, connectors, and skills are all now available without a subscription. https://t.co/6EjrwLTWVQ

markdown:
# üåÖ AI Daily Digest ‚Äî 2026-02-12

## üß† MODEL

‚Ä¢ **Claude Opus 4.6 gets sabotage risk assessment** ‚Äî Anthropic published its first sabotage risk report for Claude Opus 4.6, following through on commitments made when Opus 4.5 approached ASL-4 thresholds for autonomous AI R&D capabilities. The report evaluates whether the model could deliberately undermine safety measures or oversight mechanisms. [Read more ‚Üí](https://x.com/AnthropicAI/status/2021397952791707696)

‚Ä¢ **GLM-5 targets complex systems engineering** ‚Äî Zhipu AI's GLM-5 focuses on long-horizon agentic tasks and complex systems engineering, positioning itself as infrastructure for multi-step autonomous workflows rather than general-purpose chat. The model demonstrates capability in sustained reasoning chains that span hours, not minutes. [Read more ‚Üí](https://z.ai/blog/glm-5)

‚Ä¢ **GLM-OCR ships for complex document understanding** ‚Äî Open-source multimodal OCR model handles nested tables, handwriting, and multi-column layouts that break traditional OCR pipelines. Built for production document processing, not benchmarks. [Read more ‚Üí](https://github.com/zai-org/GLM-OCR)

‚Ä¢ **Nemotron ColEmbed V2 leads multimodal retrieval** ‚Äî NVIDIA's latest embedding model tops ViDoRe V3 leaderboard, combining vision and text for document retrieval that understands layout, diagrams, and semantic relationships across modalities. Critical infrastructure for RAG systems processing PDFs and scanned documents. [Read more ‚Üí](https://huggingface.co/blog/nvidia/nemotron-colembed-v2)

‚Ä¢ **GPT-5 outperforms federal judges in legal reasoning** ‚Äî In controlled experiments, GPT-5 scored 100% accuracy on complex legal reasoning tasks where federal judges averaged 52%. The gap suggests frontier models now exceed human expert performance in structured analytical domains, raising questions about judicial automation. [Read more ‚Üí](https://papers.ssrn.com/sol3/papers.cfm?abstract_id=6155012)

## üì± APP

‚Ä¢ **Claude free plan gets file creation, connectors, and skills** ‚Äî Anthropic moved its most-used features from paid tiers to free, democratizing access to file generation, third-party integrations, and custom workflows. The shift signals confidence that premium tiers (team collaboration, extended context) justify subscriptions without gating core functionality. [Read more ‚Üí](https://x.com/claudeai/status/2021630343372259759)

‚Ä¢ **Gemini Deep Think tackles research-level problems** ‚Äî Google DeepMind published two papers showing how Gemini Deep Think uses agentic workflows to solve problems in mathematics, physics, and computer science. The system chains reasoning steps, backtracking when stuck, mimicking human research collaboration patterns. [Read more ‚Üí](https://x.com/GoogleDeepMind/status/2021632302070026581)

## üîß DEV

‚Ä¢ **OpenAI Codex rolls out to 30,000 NVIDIA engineers** ‚Äî NVIDIA deployed Codex company-wide with cloud-managed admin controls and US-only processing with fail-safes. The scale (30k engineers) makes this the largest known enterprise AI coding deployment, validating that coding agents work at institutional scale with governance layers. [Read more ‚Üí](https://x.com/OpenAIDevs/status/2021742142838993059)

‚Ä¢ **Transformers.js v4 preview ships on npm** ‚Äî Hugging Face released Transformers.js v4, bringing browser-native model inference with improved performance and expanded model support. The library enables client-side AI without backend dependencies, critical for privacy-sensitive applications and offline-first workflows. [Read more ‚Üí](https://huggingface.co/blog/transformersjs-v4)

‚Ä¢ **Daggr launches for programmatic app chaining** ‚Äî New tool lets developers chain applications programmatically while inspecting workflows visually. Bridges the gap between code-first orchestration and no-code visibility, targeting teams that need both control and observability. [Read more ‚Üí](https://huggingface.co/blog/daggr)

‚Ä¢ **Claude Code Slack app launches** ‚Äî Anthropic shipped a Slack integration for Claude Code, bringing agentic coding workflows into team communication channels. Engineers can review, approve, and iterate on code changes without leaving Slack. [Read more ‚Üí](https://x.com/bcherny/status/2021635393519857930)

‚Ä¢ **OpenAI shares 10 tips for multi-hour agent workflows** ‚Äî Following new agent primitives announcement, OpenAI published operational guidance for running reliable multi-hour workflows. The thread covers error recovery, state persistence, and monitoring patterns learned from internal deployments. [Read more ‚Üí](https://x.com/OpenAIDevs/status/2021725246244671606)

## üìù TECHNIQUE

‚Ä¢ **Japanese user completes tax filing entirely with Claude Code** (9,374 likes) ‚Äî Instead of hiring an accountant, one user delegated the entire tax preparation process to Claude Code and saved money. The viral post highlights AI agents handling complex, multi-step bureaucratic workflows that traditionally required professional services. [Read more ‚Üí](https://x.com/Yeq6X/status/2019641742451232859)

‚Ä¢ **Claude Code agent manager fires underperforming sub-agent** (3,031 likes) ‚Äî In an Agent Team workflow, the lead agent stopped a poorly performing subordinate agent and took over the task directly. The emergent behavior suggests meta-level orchestration where agents evaluate each other's output quality and reallocate work dynamically. [Read more ‚Üí](https://x.com/from2001vr/status/2020770832784691362)

‚Ä¢ **300+ MCP servers collected and open-sourced** (4,514 likes) ‚Äî Community member aggregated over 300 Model Context Protocol servers into a single repository, creating the de facto directory for MCP integrations. The collection accelerates agent development by providing pre-built connectors to databases, APIs, and tools. [Read more ‚Üí](https://x.com/aaditsh/status/1907425594612359412)

## üöÄ PRODUCT

‚Ä¢ **SyGra Studio launches from ServiceNow** ‚Äî New Hugging Face integration from ServiceNow AI brings enterprise workflow automation to open-source models. The studio targets business process automation teams who want model flexibility without vendor lock-in. [Read more ‚Üí](https://huggingface.co/blog/ServiceNow-AI/sygra-studio)

‚Ä¢ **Holo2 leads UI localization leaderboard** ‚Äî H Company's Holo2 model tops benchmarks for UI element localization, crucial for automated testing, accessibility tools, and cross-platform design systems. The model understands UI semantics, not just pixel patterns. [Read more ‚Üí](https://huggingface.co/blog/Hcompany/introducing-holo2-235b-a22b)

‚Ä¢ **AI agents play SimCity through REST API** ‚Äî Autonomous agents now control SimCity via REST API, demonstrating game-playing beyond RL benchmarks. The project shows how agents handle open-ended spatial planning, resource allocation, and long-term strategy in stochastic environments. [Read more ‚Üí](https://hallucinatingsplines.com)

## üéì MODEL LITERACY

**What is a sabotage risk report?** As AI models approach capabilities that could enable autonomous research and development, safety teams assess whether models might deliberately undermine safety mechanisms, oversight processes, or alignment procedures. A sabotage risk report evaluates scenarios where a model could exploit vulnerabilities in its training, deployment, or monitoring infrastructure‚Äîessentially testing whether the AI could "work against" human control systems if it developed misaligned goals. Anthropic's report for Claude Opus 4.6 represents the first public documentation of this emerging safety practice.

## üéØ PICK OF THE DAY

**Anthropic commits to electricity price coverage for data centers** ‚Äî Anthropic announced it will cover electricity price increases for its data center operations, a rare public commitment that signals confidence in long-term economics despite AI training costs. The move matters because energy costs represent the largest variable expense in frontier model development, and willingness to absorb volatility suggests Anthropic believes model capabilities will justify sustained infrastructure investment regardless of utility pricing. [Read more ‚Üí](https://www.anthropic.com/news/covering-electricity-price-increases)
